channel.title: [PI] Cannot connect from host or different IP
channel.description:
I am new with Java, mainly just putting something up for me and my friends to play at school.
I cannot connect to it though, from either my host computer, or my laptop, which is hooked up to a different network. On my host computer, I use 127.0.0.1 and I use my No-IP for my laptop. Is there anything I am doing wrong server sided?
I am portforwarded to 43594, the server is running as well as No-IP.

item.title: [PI] Cannot connect from host or different IP
item.dc:creator: @xEvilGSx xEvilGSx
item.description:
@xEvilGSx wrote:

There is no “Gui.java” and I did check Client.java.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Cannot connect from host or different IP

item.title: [PI] Cannot connect from host or different IP
item.dc:creator: @Learning_Code Learning Code
item.description:
@Learning_Code wrote:

You need to make sure the port is open, you may have missed a Server Ip somewhere in the client. just double check in GUI, and Client

Read full topic
